issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem is a duplicate of an existing issue.
resolution.name: Duplicate

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Choose Samples tab next to Console box in Appcelerator Studio.
2. Choose Todo List from Alloy samples.

h3. Actual Result
In Project Explorer treeview with ToDo List node is empty.

h3. Expected Result
Working imported sample project.
fields.summary: Import sample Todo List does not work

comments.body:
Hello, 

I tried to test the issue you have reported. I was able to create a sample todo list project and successfully build the project in iOS. Can you prodide screenshots of what it's showing in your studio?

Regards,
Sharif.

Hello,
Sample {{Todo List}} alloy app works fine in my system.
*Steps:*
1. Go to Dashboard.
2. In {{Get Started Quickly With Sample Apps}} click "more".[Screenshot| https://i.imgsafe.org/18061ae.png]
3. In samples tab select {{Todo List}} among alloy samples. [Screenshot|https://i.imgsafe.org/9ee1db2.png]
4. "New Sample Project" window is opened. Click finish. (I did rename the project to Todo ListAlloy ) [Screenshot| https://i.imgsafe.org/db5afe9.png]
5. In Project Explorer the project node is displayed.[Screenshot| https://i.imgsafe.org/f3a1576.png]
6. Build and run the app.


*Environment*:

*Device info:* Nexus7 (android 6.0.1)
*Node.js Version:* 0.12.7
*npm Version:* 2.11.3
*Titanium SDKs:* 5.2.2.GA and 5.2.1.GA
*Java Development Kit Version:* 1.8.0_73
*Titanium CLI Version:*  5.0.5
*Appcelerator CLI Version:*  5.2.2
*Appcelerator Studio:* 4.5.0

Hello Sharif and Nazmus,

By the way this error occurred on Windows 10 so I deleted one part via npm and appc and the other .files via Windows Explorer.
I have checked and cleaned too the registry.

For you info, I installed recently a clean Windows 10 Pro on this machine and other dev tools before Studio.
The re-install via above method was no problem. But after I installed Appcelerator Studio and tried to create a new or import an existing sample the same problem occurred. I checked my laptop for Node version etc. because this machine had also a clean Windows 10 Pro install and had no problems with Appcelerator Studio and other dev tools using npm.

NOTICE: The problem machine had NodeJS 0.12 installed... very old.

In the weekend I am going to do a clean install and will let you know if the problem is gone.
Maybe the old NodeJS version has messed things up during install.

Regards and a nice weekend,
Erik
